t: For the choir director. A psalm of David. A song.
Praise*pn is rightfully yours, God,*ln in Zion; vows*ln to you will be fulfilled.
All*ln humanity will come to you, the*ln one who hears prayer.
Iniquities*ln overwhelm me; only*ln you can atone for our rebellions.
How*ln happy is the one you choose and*ln bring near to live in your courts! We*ln will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, the*ln holiness of your temple.
You*pn answer us in righteousness, with*ln awe-inspiring works, God*ln of our salvation, the*ln hope of all the ends of the earth and*ln of the distant seas.
You*ln establish the mountains by your power; you*ln are robed with strength.
You*ln silence the roar of the seas, the*ln roar of their waves, and*ln the tumult of the nations.
Those*ln who live far away are awed by your signs; you*ln make east and west shout for joy.
You*pn visit the earth and water it abundantly, enriching*ln it greatly. God’s*ln stream is filled with water, for*ln you prepare the earth in this way, providing*ln people with grain.
You*ln soften it with showers and bless its growth, soaking*ln its furrows and leveling its ridges.
You*ln crown the year with your goodness; your*ln carts overflow with plenty.
The*ln wilderness pastures overflow, and*ln the hills are robed with joy.
The*ln pastures are clothed with flocks and*ln the valleys covered with grain. They*ln shout in triumph; indeed, they sing.
